definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Yang Yun, her son, in his childhood, liked reading his grandfather's unopened manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 其外孙杨恽从小爱读外公这部尚未公开的书稿。

sentences.english: And slowly, diffidently, the number of these sheets has grown.
sentences.chinese: 书稿缓慢地，踌躇地一页页增加。

sentences.english: I recently read an excerpt from her manuscript, which starts with her personal journey.
sentences.chinese: 我最近读到她书稿的一个节选，从她的个人经历开始。

sentences.english: Each time I began to read and edit the manuscript, I felt more peaceful.
sentences.chinese: 每次我开始编审书稿后，我感觉更和平。

sentences.english: And so, how does my experience inform the books I've written?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我的生活经历如何引导我下笔写出这些书稿？

definition: to go to press/to submit for printing
to send (a manuscript) to the press
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
